title: Meta-Learning from Verification History
goal: Learn from verification history to improve future decisions
concept: System accumulates verification experience and learns optimal depth/mode selection patterns

learned_insights.finding: STANDARD depth produces highest quality (0.409 avg)
learned_insights.recommendation: Prefer STANDARD depth when ATP allows

learned_insights.finding: DEEP depth fails consistently (0.0 quality, 0% success)
learned_insights.likely_cause: Identity grounding requirements too strict at DEEP level

key_findings: ✅ Depth preferences learned (STANDARD best, DEEP worst)
⚠️ DEEP depth consistently fails (identity grounding issue)
⚠️ Low confidence on some insights (need more samples)
architectural_insights: System can learn from experience without external supervision
Learned preferences can guide future depth selection
Confidence scoring enables cautious application of learning
Depth stability indicates predictable ATP patterns
next_steps: Increase sample size for higher confidence
Fix DEEP depth identity grounding issue
Implement learned depth selection in production
convergence_contribution: First implementation of meta-learning for internal verification. Demonstrates continuous improvement through experience accumulation. Validates that verification systems can learn optimal strategies without external training.
